website_summaries.verdict: For the appearance-conscience – some tuners are big and bulky, but the D'Addario is nearly invisible when placed on the head stock.
pros: Very small and unobtrusive while playing
Includes a basic metronome for rehearsals
Display is easy to read from many angles
cons: Proper placement on neck can be challenging
Audible buzzing and rattling noise on certain instruments
Does not work well in loud environments

customer_reviews.title: Garbage buy something else and don't trust amazon reviews
customer_reviews.text: Check other web sites for "NS Micro Tuner just flashes" it's garbage. I replaced the battery and it still doesn't come up. Made sure to not have to Metronome on etc, and no go. it just flashes and flashes. I wish hadn't trusted the reviews on Amazon for this product and instead looked elsewhere. This is the second garbage item I've bought from D'Addario, and will never purchase anything from them again. The planet waves cable I bought from them was broken right out of the box. They used to be a good company, not sure what happen, probably moved all their manufacturing to China and now this it the low quality garbage they'll be remembered for. good job.
customer_reviews.author: Dorgin

customer_reviews.title: Regretful Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought two two-packs of these tuners and it was a waste of $40. The tuning accuracy is poor. I mounted these on my Fender Telecasters and a Stratocaster. The only location to mount the tuners is on the headstock near the neck. However, when I placed my guitars in the stands I use, the tuners slid upward on the headstock and it ruined the decal on one of my Teles. Really pissed me off. Did the jackasses at D'Addario actually try these tuners on a variety of guitars? I'm probably going to take the batteries out of these tuners to salvage some value. The units will then be tossed in the trash where they belong.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Donofrio

customer_reviews.title: Useless.
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Will NOT register a low E. Constantly flashes between other notes when dialing in on a a string (flashes f# when trying to dial in on a B for example). Clip device is awkward to put on and off. No pad on clip, just plastic. Extremely disappointed with D'Addario. I have a free cheapy clip on that came with a $50 uke that works MUCH better than this!
customer_reviews.author: K. Choquette

customer_reviews.title: New NS Micro Tuner for 2019, brighter, easier to read, more accurate, perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon.com is now shipping the new D’Addario NS Micro Clip-On Tuner introduced at NAMM 2019 with a brighter , easier to read, and sharper display. The new Clip-On tuner has the same round mount as the existing Clip-Free tuner, so you can easily remove the Clip-On bracket from the new tuner, and mount it to the Clip-Free tuner bracket as shown on my acoustic guitar. A great discreet tuner, made better! Update: I tested the new tuner outdoors and it's brighter and has better contrast than the old model making it much easier to read in direct daylight! Thank you D’Addario. I've already purchased a few more for other guitars.
customer_reviews.author: kahrweil

customer_reviews.title: Small & barely noticeable
customer_reviews.text: The pitch indicator, "G", or whatever, is large & very easy to read, but I don't find the little lines showing movement flat or sharp all that easy to use. It sits very close to the instrument, so isn't "distracting" to the audience. But I don't find it as versatile as the Snark style which you can bend to whatever angle suits you perfectly "at this moment", between your eyes and the location it needs to be on a particular instrument. Doesn't hurt to have 2 extra tuners to avoid having to switch between instruments, so put it on the ones it suits best.
customer_reviews.author: T. Scheer

customer_reviews.title: So small and unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.text: I like how small this is. I leave it on the head of my Les Paul and it's always there when I need it. It will fit on top of or on the underside of most guitar headstocks and the display is reversible so it's easy to read whatever side you want it on.
customer_reviews.author: William Anderson827

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Cheap Snark tuner
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I need for my guitars. I love that they can calibrate to 432 Hz without going through all kinds of complicated adjustments. They are very low profile and blend right into the headstock of a guitar without sticking way out. The range is suited for a guitar so trying to tune a higher or lower pitched instrument may be a little less reliable. I tested it on my piano and it is good for two octaves higher and lower from middle C. (I have been using Snark tuners until now and very frustrated that they break so easily. Even had a couple turn bad because of cheap plastic breaking down and getting sticky)
customer_reviews.author: c s o music

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great, but a few small issues
customer_reviews.text: The size and readability are excellent. My main issue is that it's hard to get a reading for the low E string about 70% of the time. Nothing happens on the tuner, just a dash as if nothing is being played. I have to start to move the tuning peg or play another string first, then maybe it picks it up. It also doesn't seem to be super accurate. There's not enough detail to make sure I'm really dialed in, so I sometimes have to resort to another tuner to get perfectly tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Glen R - Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: small and works well
customer_reviews.text: I owned the prior variant of the D’Addario NS Micro and bought this 2-pack since I wanted more of the same. Indeed, it's very similar in form and function as last year's model but has a faster start-up, slightly faster pitch read, and a color display. The ratchet style mount appears to be the same as prior generations and is just as small and discreet. The only small negative is the on-off button, a combo rocker switch, is stiffer and required a precise press—resulting in several attempts to power on whereas the soft-touch button of the older model was a 100% hit rate for me.
customer_reviews.author: P.K. Frary

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em. They sholud make a six pack.
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. They are easy to read without my glasses, accurate and I love that they can go either on top or under the head stock and the display flips. They fit on almost any head stock. They do not however fit my violin or stay on my Woodrow because of the small, odd head stock shapes. I can live with that. At the Amazon price point I have one on each of my guitars and my bass and mando so I never have to go searching for a tuner at home and I am ready to roll if I am playing out. The only one I don't keep one on is the Gibson with the nitro finish.
customer_reviews.author: Deb G

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the recommendations for this purchase. Turned out to be the right decision (so far). + Good , efficiently designed product + Pretty accurate + Easy to use, easily fitted + Clear display, simple button functions + Pretty low cost and worth every penny (so far) - Limited functionalities (not really an issue in my case) - Pretty small (again, not a problem in my case) Item was quickly shipped and promptly delivered.
customer_reviews.author: siv v

customer_reviews.title: Harldy ever picks up any notes. Waste of silicon and plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Useless tuner. I have a Gibson Les Paul and it only fits on the top of the headstock and doesn't pick up notes 90% of the time. Even if I pluck the stings like I'm trying to shoot an arrow from my guitar it doesn't detect any notes, which is even more useless because then the note is a different pitch. I hate this tuner. I almost just threw it into my back garden. I'm giving it away not to someone with an acoustic guitar. Maybe they will have better luck with that instrument.
customer_reviews.author: littlemisspreceptor

customer_reviews.title: It's small .. but ..
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this since I hate seeing those larger clip-on tuners sitting on headstocks. This one is very small and discrete, can mount it on underside of the headstock near the nut, bass string side. There it's out of the way of your hands and eyes from onlookers. BUT .. it's a little slow to read the note for some reason, and that's why I reduced stars. But I do like it for a "clip-on" solution and will keep it and use it. The display is very bright and easy to read. The adjustability when mounted is good, and seems to clip on/off without much fuss or any scratching/other damage. Time will tell ...
customer_reviews.author: P. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Better than ever
customer_reviews.text: D’Addario is the best. I had the previous model and it is really good. This version is even better. Easier to read. Much brighter. The display is clearer whilst tuning. Still deadly accurate and fast. I hope the batteries last as long. I do not like the battery tray. The packaging doesn't have instructions for removing it and it fits tightly so it is a little scary the first time you do it. Previous model has a quarter-turn cap. I like that. I was given a tuner from a different manufacturer. It didn't work well on my electric guitar. And it ate batteries, so I retired it with extreme prejudice. This
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient but sometimes doesn't pick up the vibrations
customer_reviews.text: I really like the low profile design of this product. It really clips on to a headstock discreetly compared to other options like Snarks. The screen rotation button also makes it easy to optimize the display for reading regardless of how you clip it to the headstock. What I don't like about it is that it sometimes doesn't sense low E. I'll have to pluck the string a couple times and sometimes resort to using harmonics to get it to pick up the vibration. This is the case on multiple guitars clipped on multiple headstock locations so it's probably an inherent weakness in the product's design.
customer_reviews.author: uhnonimuss

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Stay On
customer_reviews.text: I guess this would be OK if you didn't move your guitar around much. But if you go over a friends house with your guitar, or put it in your car, or move you guitar from house to house, or floor to floor, or gig with it, the tuner doesn't clamp securely enough to stay on the guitar. I lost both tuners within a couple months. They probably slipped off as I was transporting the guitar. I'm going to look for the ones that fasten on the nut because these don't stay on. I don't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Francis N. DeSalvo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty crappy. It doesn’t pickup the lower strings so you have to trick it into working by starting with the higher strings. If you don’t, then it will just sit there in standby mode while you pluck away as loud as you can like an idiot waiting for it to detect your pitch. And even then, most of the time it still has trouble with the bottom three strings. Total waste of money. Whoop dee doo that it comes with two, just having one that works would be better. I don’t care if it’s inexpensive, all it is is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with placement on bass
customer_reviews.text: I have the clip-on version of this same tuner and it works fine with bas in just about any location. There is something about the no-clip (screw-in) version that does not work with the low A and E strings on a bass unless it is connected to the back of the E string tuner. Anywhere else, it won't detect the low A and E strings. Tried different positions, no good. Also, this tuner can get in the way of guitar stands and hangars that hold from the headstock. Other than that, it works. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Synergy Sales

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact and serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this little one works great! Serves it's intended purpose and that's what I needed it for. Clamps onto the guitar head nice and discreetly. Buttons to orientate the screen how ever you need. I haven't really messed with the other features but it works right out of the box. Good price. Good quality. Screen is well lit and easy to read. Overall I'm happy with my purchase and D'Addario gained a new customer. I believe in quality but also budget friendly and these guys nailed it!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Foltz

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Tuner - Big Results
customer_reviews.text: The "biggest" selling point is the small size. They hide unobtrusively even on a ukulele headstock. You can put your guitar back in the case and leave them on. They are more than accurate enough and more accurate than my ear but there are larger and more expensive more accurate tuners on the market. They are easy to read and easy to use in the basic functions. I didn't need instructions to get started. However, if you want to change the reference tuning point from 440, you probably need some internet instruction.
customer_reviews.author: John U

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: The built-in tuner on my 20 year old Ovation acoustic guitar had died, and the factory said they don't carry that model any more. So I needed a small clamp on. I had a previous model of this tuner that worked well. But I took it to use on a guitar while I was away from home, and lost it. This newer model is way easier to read with the color display. Seems to be even more sensitive and accurate. It's small and fits on the back of the head stock so it's almost invisible. I'm totally happy with it. Bought two so that I can put one on my 40 year old acoustic too.
customer_reviews.author: John Hazard

customer_reviews.title: Fair to very good, depends on the instrument
customer_reviews.text: I love the low profile design, the clear display, and the ability to rotate the display to suit where you mount the tuner. Accuracy across my instruments ranges from very good (but not great) to not particularly good. Problems, where they do occur, tend to be on the lower notes of a guitar. Some notes are mis-labeled (though produce the right tuning result if you just ignore the letter) while others are just not picked up adequately to provide a useful tuning. I'll keep them on the instruments where they work well but will use my Snark for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Clark

customer_reviews.title: It’s barely useable
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to give this tuner a go on my bass. Loved the low profile and easy set up. Sadly, for bass, this tuner falls flat (no pun intended). The g and d strings tune somewhat well but you can forget the low e and b (on a 5 string). Even when trying to use 12th fret harmonics this tuner’s tracking is awful. I gave it a go on one of my electric guitars and it’s marginally better and somewhat useable. While extremely aesthetically unpleasant and totally giving off strong “dad” vibes, the snark tuners are far superior. Don’t waste your time with this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Least Favorite Clip-on Tuner
customer_reviews.text: This is the third style of clip-on tuner that I've tried, and I don't care much for it. It's nice and small, with a bright display, and you can rotate the orientation for clipping on top, or under the head-stock. However, it doesn't always read the note correctly. For instance; when turning my D string it will display F#. I have to mute all the other strings before it can zero in on the D string. My other tuners don't seem to have this problem. It seems to do better if I really clamp it down tight, but I'm afraid that the plastic will break over time. The spring loaded style seems to work better.
customer_reviews.author: Aerobatx

customer_reviews.title: Small, but might be an issue depending on headstock
customer_reviews.text: Unlike a snark that has the electronic part stick out away from your tuners, this clips right on to the headstock. Even though this is small, its bigger than the clamp on a snark, and it was an issue fitting on a couple of my electrics. So they seem decent if they fit, the display is easy to read, but not so great if the headstock doesn't have enough space near the tuners. Next time I need to buy another clip on I'll probably just stick with snark - they are more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: SamIam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't respond to Low E string on guitars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't respond to low E string on a guitar. I bought 3 of them and tested them all on a variety of guitars in different spots. I think that they botched it when trying to make it less sensitive to room noise. Clever design. Maybe too clever. I suggest that you stop guessing and buy a Peterson Strobotuner. It's more expensive but it's accurate and what pros use. Or get a tuning fork and use your ear. But these cheap ones aren't worth a cent...
customer_reviews.author: John E. Laser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for classical guitar
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's perfect for ANY guitar, but a different tuner I had bought earlier was barely able to clip onto the thicker head stock of a classical guitar, compared to the relatively narrower steel-string acoustic or electric guitar. I still had to experiment with this one, but at its maximum width it fits my classical guitar perfectly. I do wish it had even just a bit more adjustment width because even this one is at its maximum (any further adjustment would separate the clip from the tuner), but it does fit properly and I can leave it at its set width without having to be extremely careful when attaching it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great little Tuner
customer_reviews.text: I saw a well respected bassist using this on Facebook who recommended it over another type of clip on tuner I use. The mane selling point is that the other tuners have a neck that raises the tuner to a higher level. The issue is they tend to pop off the base or fall off altogether in the gigbag and cases. This can be left without that issue. The screen is a little smaller even with my bad vision I can read the note and see when I am in tune. I have multiple basses I use at different time and plan to put one on each. The price is very good too. I highly recommend this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chromatic with Options.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to read for being small. I like using different tunings. Today's standard is 440 hz is a lot higher than the tunings of the past. A lot of guitar players tune down a semitone. As a singer song writer this tuner let's you tune down lower. It's easier to hit the high notes. This tuner stays where you want it. You can have A equal to as low as 415 hz. Break the rules be yourself and find your voice. If your in tune no will notice your up or down a few cents. This tuner does it and stays where you want it.
customer_reviews.author: brojohnw

customer_reviews.title: Great but Struggles with Low E
customer_reviews.text: It’s the most convenient, easy-to-use, and light weight tuner I’ve ever had. The screen is bright, colorful and easy to see. Fits all of my head stocks - Strat, Tele, and Les Paul electrics as well as my Lakewood and Fender acoustics. The only negative - which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 - is that it struggles to recognize the low E string. Sometimes it does not register at all. It’s not a terribly big deal, however, as it works if I hit the low E string’s 12th fret harmonic.
customer_reviews.author: RPD

customer_reviews.title: Best Tuner Available
customer_reviews.text: I really like these tuners. I always hated having a big tuner sticking off my headstock. This one is tiny, barely noticeable. The screen is readable and you can adjust the orientation so it can be read regardless of the placement. It seams accurate, as I've compared to other tuners including pedals. I've bought these for each of my acoustics and plan to just always leave on the guitars. I highly recommend this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Auby

customer_reviews.title: Great Universal Tuner
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Incredibly easy to use, being chromatic, you can drop your tuning to your needs. I purchased the universal tuner, so it clips on my acoustic and electric guitars with ease. LED light is brightly displayed, and the tuner rotated 360 degrees so very flexible for whatever position and direction you like. It’s worth the price and twice as accurate as my previous clip on from a different company. I like it a lot!
customer_reviews.author: The Grateful Dad

customer_reviews.title: Does not come as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I'll probably keep the tuner(s) because I don't need the hassle of shipping them back but... 1. I must have received the older version because there was no metronome as the video states there would be. 2. It sometimes does not recognize when a string is plucked. The response time is often slow. 3. I thought I had ordered a package of 2 tuners, but they sent 2 packages of 2 and now I have paid double what I anticipated (I should have checked closer). Careless me! 4. The clamps are not spring loaded, therefore they are likely to be knocked off. 5. The display is relatively small and hard to see. I don't recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small size, easy to conceal on headstock, dependable.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on a mandolin and several guitars. I've owned three or four of these little tuners. My brother builds guitars and recommended this tuner to me, and it works pretty well. It's a little hard to see when mounted on the back of the headstock on some instruments, due to the placement of the tuning pegs on the guitar. But that's a minor inconvenience and easy to adjust to. The features are nice, with the ability to reverse the image to allow for different location placements on the guitar. It's a bit pricy compared to other products on the market, but only slightly so. It's my go-to tuner now.
customer_reviews.author: Steve VanDyke

customer_reviews.title: Nice pro tuner. Best I've seen on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Is discreet. Will sort of not clip as nicely as it could due to your truss rod plate size up towards the finger board. Wish it had a longer and heavier duty tongue. The whole thing would be perfect if it was rubberized on the exterior so as not to overly scratch your guitar. However, those things said: the screen flipper is a really nice feature. This is really nice lil tuner and I plan on buy one for all my guitars and basses. It's about the size of ur thumb up to the first knuckle. Ain't no goofy looking Snark. lol
customer_reviews.author: mr. ed

customer_reviews.title: Nice, with one annoying flaw...
customer_reviews.text: The tuner itself is pretty accurate and easy to use, and it's small and easy to keep out of the way... but good god, the buttons on it are so loose that if you strum hard (or pluck hard on a bass) they hum and buzz and it's annoying and difficult to ignore once you notice it. They're fine if you play through headphones, or play loud enough that you won't notice it... but at bedroom/apartment levels it's a noticeable and annoying buzz that ruins what would be an otherwise great tuner for the super affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but mine is defective
customer_reviews.text: The one star review is because I may have received a defective product; it randomly stopped working and won't power on even with new batteries That being said, this is still a good product. It's discreet enough that it can be left on your guitar's headstock without anyone ever noticing it was there. It's accurate as well. My only real problem is with the mechanism to lock it to the headstock. As you can see, it's plastic with ridges to lock into. But, headstocks aren't necessarily within the same increments as such ridges, and so it doesn't always fit snugly on the headstock.
customer_reviews.author: Spooky

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for price
customer_reviews.text: I like these little tuners. Been using them for about six months now. For the price they do a pretty good job. Easy to read , accurate, unobtrusive. I actually like the method the display uses to show tuning status. I have four, one of the four is just a little laggy but just a touch so.. might be just the guitar and where it's attached. All in all they are a decent tuner. You can leave them attached when putting your guitar in the case due to their very low profile.. Auto shut-off battery last long time. Very indiscreet. I'd buy again ..
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Better than others
customer_reviews.text: I've had these tuners for a while now. I didn't really like the pinch mechanism on these. I thought it was too tight and could damage a finish. However they haven't caused any damage. And as it turns out this tuner is much more responsive than other clip on tuners that I have. Most clip on tuners take a 1/2 second or so to respond so you have to wait after every adjustment. But these tuners respond much quicker.
customer_reviews.author: K. B. L.

customer_reviews.title: My bad
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with the tuner and at the price I’m not going to return it. Frankly I confuse myself by looking on YouTube for a review. The review had the model that has a Metronome. Shame on me because I assumed this one did too. I cannot even find a Metronome model on their website anymore. I’m assuming that they quit making it. Whatever the case, I’m happy with the tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Peter E. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Works Better on My 5 String Banjo Than Full Size Clip On Tuners
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 5 string banjo. Tried two different clip on types on the head of my banjo, but they did not pick up the high G string unless I plucked it very hard. I suspect this is because the high G doesn't terminate on the headstock. The mini clips on my resonator, which the other clip ons would not. Picks up all strings. Also is easier to read as it is now closer to my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry from Chiswick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stealth tuner, works better than clip-ons.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best contact-based tuner I have ever used for bass. By bolting on rather than clipping on, it is more tightly connected to the headstock and is more accurate, especially with the E string. It tracks faster as well. Installing it was a breeze, and it is well designed (display is bright and can be flipped easily with a button; controls are intuitive). I wish I had always had one; gone are the bad old days of those Korg tuners that would eat AAs. I used this on a Rickenbacker bass and can confirm it fits nicely and is invisible from the front.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: NO METRONOME included
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be less accurate than the tuner that is built my Yamaha THR guitar amp. The display is so small, it is difficult to read at times. Unfortunately, the small clip on version of this tuner DOES NOT FEATURE A METRONOME despite the description on amazon stating otherwise. I should have know it due to the lack of the metronome button that is present on the other versions of this tuner. Too much hassle to return it, as it was really affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: discrete and functional
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a long term review so I can't speak to durability yet, but I love the size for my Taylor 214. I just hate the common style that looks like I have a monitor attached to the headstock of my guitar. So far it works great and I think the ability to flip the screen direction is awesome so it's right-reading. The only issue (which I seem to have on most tuners that aren't in line) is that it has a bit of trouble picking up the low E string. I have to hit it just right to get a solid read. Otherwise it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Myztro

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Tuner and Inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: I love these tuners! I have an extensive collection of Ukuleles, Banjoleles and Tenor Guitars that hang on the walls of my Home Office which is kept at 50% humidity. Every instrument has this tuner installed on the headstock. (I order batteries by the dozen on Amazon.com!) It is great to mute the phone on a boring conference call, grab an instrument while propping your feet up on the desk and pick away! These tuners are very easy to reorient if you move them from the top of the headstock to underneath, just press one button and they correct their orientation.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Headless Bass
customer_reviews.text: With just a little whittling to the tab at the end of the clamp I was able to get this to work with my headless Hohner/Steinberg Bass. This was ideal since no modifications were made to the bass. Another nice feature is that it will tune the low E string without having to resort to using the octave harmonic.
customer_reviews.author: MLC

customer_reviews.title: This is a Snark killer
customer_reviews.text: I have several clip on tuners. This is the ONE. I like the fact you can conceal it, with only the clip showing, behind the headstock is the unit. Pretty much a no brainer, button for on/off, rotate display, up and down (adjust frequency sample (410-480Hz) or a visual metronome. Think I’ll be replacing all my tuners except the novelty “Shaka” tuner, nothing’s cooler than a Shaka tuner, Aloha
customer_reviews.author: TrafficMan

customer_reviews.title: Very good but littel troublesum with low E
customer_reviews.text: Got two of them. One for an LP another for a Tele. Both are great, fit well but once you put on, if you hang you guitars, this will get in the way. Non the less they are very accurate works better with Harmonic tuning rather than free strum. However with Harmonic tuning it has a hard time focusing on the Low E. This is the same issue on both devices and on both guitars.
customer_reviews.author: Irv

customer_reviews.title: convenient
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. I bought a two-pack and liked them so much I bought two more. I like that I can leave one on each of my guitars and not have to mess with them. The only caveat so far is that in some live lighting situations they are so small they are hard to read. The other issue is that depending on where you clip it on your head-stock it doesn't always detect the low E string which is a pain when tuning back up from a drop D between songs. But I won't rate it down because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Taulbee

customer_reviews.title: Solid for 5 of 6 strings
customer_reviews.text: It has a hard time picking up the low-E strong on my Martin guitar. I have it situated at the top of my guitar and it picks up the other 5 strings with some measure of accuracy. It doesn't seem to register the low-E until I've played a few E-harmonics. I retrospect, I should have spent a bit more money for a more accurate and sensitive tuner. But it's a good price if you don't mind a little inconsistency.
customer_reviews.author: foxfour

customer_reviews.title: Good tuner, deficient instructions.
customer_reviews.text: This is a popular tuner among the acoustic musicians I play with, so I got one. And its easy to use once you figure it out. But the employees who write the instructions for the package and produce the video are a bunch of real comedians. Here’s what they need o tell you. It comes with the battery installed, but the little plastic tab sticking out is connected to a circle of insulating plastic to keep the battery from discharging before you get the tuner. The battery is held in place by a circlip shaped piece of the housing. Wiggle that loose, remove the insulation, and you ll figure out the rest.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: D'Addario NS Tuner
customer_reviews.text: These tuners work great, and fit both my Gibson J-200, and my Gibson Dove perfectly. The tuners are very easy to operate, and are very accurate. I am amazed that something this small is as accurate or better than my larger units. My larger units needed a quiet room to tune my guitars, and the NS tuners can be used in a noisy environment. Love the idea that once fitted on my guitars, they can remain there forever. Now this review is based on my immediate reaction to these units, and will review at a later date after a couple of months of constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: They have cheaped out their old design
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in all my instruments , my guitars, my cigar box guitars , my mandolin and my bouzouki. I just bought a new octave mandolin and purchased a new D'Addario for it. Needless to say I was disappointed in the new design. The button on top are flat and the lights are all blue. Unlike the previous design where the light was red until the instrument in tune then the light went green. Needless to say I will not be buying any more. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Not very good for live use
customer_reviews.text: Great size, good bright screen, small compact, but very slow at displaying the tuning. It will not even pick up my low E string on my bass or acoustic. I would suggest the snark tuner, very fast and can be used in live settings
customer_reviews.author: sean johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting big things from D'Addario and was very disappointed. Even though I clamped this thing firmly to the headstock, it was hard to get an accurate reading. Sometimes you had to use a plucked note and sometimes you could use a harmonic but it was never consistent. It also had significant troubles on the low E and would not center or recognize the note. I like D'Addario stuff and use their strings all the time but in this situation a Shark works much better. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Martin R. Raymon

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a tuner that was unobtrusive, would fit under the headstock,and be easy to use. This tuner checks all of these boxes. It's bright and easy to see. It automatically adjusts to the orientation its been installed. The power button is easy to find and it turns on and off very quickly. The one demerit I might give it is that it doesn't clamp onto the headstock quite firmly enough and can fall off if brushed the wrong way. And since it's so small, that creates a danger of losing it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these little guys.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these little guys. I have one clipped on each of my go-to guitars, and will very likely buy more, whether it would be for me or had them out as gifts to fellow musicians. Pros: Compact. Seems accurate. Can unclip, set on a table and use as nicely visible metronome (or keep it clipped and use as metronome). They are well priced, and cheaper than buying individually at a music store chain, where i otherwise do my shopping. Cons: can't think of any at the moment. IF and WHEN i do, i will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Di

customer_reviews.title: Finally a clip on tuner that doesn't get broken in the case
customer_reviews.text: I have had over a dozen clip on tuners over the years. Most of the tuners get broken brackets if the guitar is carried in a gig bag or a tight fitting case. This one lays close enough to the headstock that it is protected by the strings and tuners. It stays in place and is ready to go without any problems. I will be ordering a few more and just leave them on the guitars. d'Addario has a winner with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Melle

customer_reviews.title: Very good, could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Small, compact, sits close to the headstock. Seems rugged. Dislikes: Small display could be more user friendly. It shows the note (DEG, etc.) in the center of the rectangular display. Then to the left or right it shows colors to indicate whether you need to tune up or down. When you are right on, it shows slim blue bars on both sides of the DEG, etc. Those blue bars could be made much larger and easier to see. It would be a simple fix and would make this a more useful tool in bright light or for those with other vision problems. I would then rate it 5 stars across the board.
customer_reviews.author: MiRo

customer_reviews.title: Highly convenient, works great
customer_reviews.text: It works as well as their clip-on tuner. Being able to screw it into the headstock via one of the tuning pegs makes it available all the time, and hides it from view. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: flux1968

customer_reviews.title: Damaged My NEW Resonator
customer_reviews.text: I clipped this upside down on the headstock, where it begins to curve from the neck and just before the 6E tuner. Because it requires a bit of pressure to turn it on, (more than it should) the edge dug a groove into my headstock. Plenty of good tuners out there - why take a chance? I would keep lookin'. (They make a soundhole tuner that's great. Small - hidden - easy to just look down and read it - Don't drop it!!!!!)
customer_reviews.author: AllenK

customer_reviews.title: Maybe smaller is better!
customer_reviews.text: My husband plays ukulele daily and thought he lost his tuner when he took it somewhere to play for friends who may or may not have wanted to hear him play. So we ordered this little tuner. And when I say "little tuner", I mean little!!! It was way smaller than he was expecting, but he ended up liking it a lot. It can clip it on to the head of his ukulele and the whole tuner piece is hidden behind the ukulele so that only he can see it. He can leave it clipped on all the time and not look like a dork with a big bulky tuner sitting like a bird on his uke.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten C

customer_reviews.title: Its small size is its big plus.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be as accurate as any other inexpensive clip on tuner and I find it to be quicker than my old Snark. Not as good as my Polytune 3 but I didn't expect it to be. Its small size, swiveling head and bright display with adjustable orientation make it a keeper. The display is small, only about 1/4 X 3/4 inches (<1 X 2 cm), but once I got used to it, I like it. I wouldn't want it to be my only tuner but I may get another. My old ears aren't that great and I wouldn't mind stowing one with each of my working guitars just in case I end up out without a tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Verloc

customer_reviews.title: Nice and minimal
customer_reviews.text: I like this clip on tuner as it is very inconspicuous and can stay on my acoustic Taylor 414CE guitar while it is put up in its case even without me having to take it off/put it back on every time I want to play. I wish the tuning was a bit quicker and more decisive though! My older Intellitouch PT10 was faster and more decisive, but it also stuck off my acoustic guitar like a sore thumb... I'm ok with using this new tuner due to the increased aesthetics and reduced hassle since I never need to take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Falciase

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: super simple to use, and easy to understand, as long as you have the basic knowledge of music of course. The only thing that bothers me, is how it grips in the guitar, can make it hard do see what the tuner is showing, so you have to strum and move the guitar a bit to see what is showing. It might be just on my Yamaha, maybe other will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Henrique Ellrich

customer_reviews.title: easy bright read and it adjusts readout. A must have for players of Indian Instruments , Sitars etc
customer_reviews.text: I liked the tuner because it's small and easily fits on the instrument. The biggest plus is that the readout can be flipped all 4 directions which is important as I bought multiple tuners one for my Ric 12 String guitar and especially for my Surbahar , which is a lower tuned 'bass' sitar. I attacked the tuner to one of the drone string pegs and the rotating selection of pitch readout was very helpful. See the picture . Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best tuner ever!
customer_reviews.text: This small tuner stays on your instrument, even in the case. That makes it so easy to tune. No hunting your tuner or having to clip it on every time you tune. They make the same tuner for violins and guitars (mandolins), so be careful when ordering. It is not always clear in the ad which instrument's tuner you are ordering. I accidentally ordered 2 tuners for guitar, when I really wanted them for the fiddle! Thankfully, I play guitar, too. I gave the 2nd tuner to a student for Christmas. The price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: i retired my Snark for these tuners. These are just as accurate as the snark and not nearly as ugly. Hides Easily behind the head stock and who doesn't like that feature. I put one on my acoustic and the other on my 12 string acoustic. i don't have to worry about knocking these things off the headstock. I am buying more for the rest of the guitars in the house...and the mandolins..and the uke....and...
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Rock Star

customer_reviews.title: I just love these...
customer_reviews.text: I just love these little tuners. I bought one for each of my guitars and a couple more for friends. They can stay on my guitars and fit in all my cases without having to remove them. They are well thought out and can go on the front or back of the head stock, and the display is reversible, so if you're looking at it upside down, press a button and it's right side up. Works well on my acoustic, electric and six string bass. I haven't used the metronome, but it has one. You can also adjust for either side of A 440.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bureau

customer_reviews.title: This is a smaller read-out than I prefer
customer_reviews.text: This is a small, small unit that will clip onto the guitar-head and be almost unseen by audiences. It's height is so low that tuner-tops stand as high from the guitar head's surface, which makes packing it with the guitar very easy. Turning it off and on, however, requires unclipping. Darn. It's so small that it's easy to leave but I wish the power-switch was at the top, not the bottom which will be on the guitar head's surface, hidden when clipped.
customer_reviews.author: EMW

customer_reviews.title: Handy little guitar or bass accessory
customer_reviews.text: Makes tuning super easy. Clips onto a guitar or bass headstock. Very small and convenient. Crisp, clear readout, accurate. Worked well on electric guitar, electric bass, acoustic guitar. Has a little trouble with the lower strings, just doesn't pick them up as well, and I have to give it a few tries. Not a dealbreaker at all, still recommended, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: bluestraggler

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding tuner!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the two pack by accident, which turned out to be a very happy accident! I put one on my main guitar and one on my bass. Both work excellent, with a simple design and operation. Both are attached at the back of the neck and are very small and inconspicuous. Love the display rotation for easy viewing in any orientation. No brainer to get these!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Troiani

customer_reviews.title: A little deaf on low E
customer_reviews.text: By and large, this is a nice guitar tuner, but it's a little deaf/insensitive on the low E string. One trick that works sometimes is to mute the other strings and hit low E hard. I think it gets confused when the other strings are ringing. This can be done without the guitar even being plugged into an amp.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Firethorn

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, small and good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The small size keeps them out of the way. I love that you can change the orientation of the display, which allows it to remain upright however you decide to attach it. I play bass and I need to let the lower notes ring for 5 seconds or so until I get a good reading, which is kind of annoying. That said, the display is actually quite bright and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: DaJamMaster

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice tuner! Small and accurate
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tuner! Small and accurate. Being able to flip the display is very nice. Though it's not perfect. The display is a bit hard to read, compared to the Snark tuners. It doesn't look crisp like the ad picture. The image looks more like a 1980 LED display with a couple lights behind it. It's nearly impossible to read in sunlight as well. I'm not sure about the metronome. I'd rather they cut this feature out and spent more money on improving the display, or making it smaller. The plastic clip feels a tad bit weak to me.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Small and Accurate, But...
customer_reviews.text: A nice small discreet tuner, but it does not want to read open E or B strings on a 6 string bass. I tried it on 3 different 6-string basses and it did the same thing on each. It reads the open C, G, D and A strings well and accurately, but I needed to tune the E and B by 12th fret harmonics. If this isn't an option for you, invest in the TC Polytuner. If it's not a problem, then this is a good, inexpensive and tiny tuner.
customer_reviews.author: scrooge

customer_reviews.title: TINY! Easy to read & use. Holds on tight.
customer_reviews.text: Ain't technology something else? From now on when i need a quick tune, i push the ON button and IT'S RIGHT THERE! No going for the bigger tuner and juggling cables. Plus it offers standard & alternate tuning. Four viewing modes: vertical, horizontal, and the "upside down" of those. Bright color display with relatively large E,A,D,G,B,E letters and multiple sharp/flat bars. Takes one inexpensive CR2032 battery. Don't know battery life yet, of course, but i'd say keep a spare handy for future use. Geez, only 11 bucks too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What did I ever do without these?
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I haven't tried any other ones of these, but these units work really well. They react quite quickly. They stay on the back of the head-stock so they are unnoticeable from the front of the guitar. Buy the two-pack as it's such a good deal and your going to want one on every guitar. I'm buying extras to give to my friends they're so cool. After using this for several months on an acoustic guitar the tuner has finally started to resonate while I'm playing making a rattling sound. It wouldn't be noticeable on an electric, but not ideal for acoustic. I had such high hopes, darnit.
customer_reviews.author: HAL9000

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my guitar. Very nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little tuner. I like the bright colors on the display menu and the fact that is has a metronome included. I wish the metronome could produce sound but since I have a metronome on my phone and an extra metronome on my guitar case, I don't think this substracts from the quality. I really like that since it's tiny I can actually leave it attached to the guitar. I think it would be great if the clip part would be bigger so it could fit on my oud but I guess you can't have it all. Anyways, really nice small tuner, accurate, discrete and practical. I Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rendon

customer_reviews.title: Not good for bass. Ok for guitars. Good design, bad accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: I also own the larger style D'Addario Eclipse tuners but I bought a pair of these micro tuners only because they small and discrete. Unfortunately, they have a very hard time picking up the bass notes accurately, as you can see in the video. I left some strings slightly Flat and sharp so you can see the reaction from both tuners. Usually, the micro tuners won't even pick up the low B, but my regular Ecplise tuners work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Love the tuner AND the customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tuner for my classical guitar last April. I love its sleek design and clear display. It was getting a little flaky so I change the battery and it no longer worked. Huh? I tested the new battery and it was good. I called customer service, left a message and they called me back shortly thereafter. They couldn't have been better to me. Although it is out of warrantee they are replacing it. So cool of them.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: BREAKS AFTER WEEK OF USE
customer_reviews.text: it worked for about 2 weeks and then stopped working. i replaced the battery and the display just flashes now with no reading and then turns back off. i replaced the battery multiple times thinking maybe the battery was just faulty, then my 2nd micro tuner stopped working the same exact way. cheap garbage, it's a shame because i liked the low profile design i was planning to outfit all of my guitars with them.
customer_reviews.author: robb frank

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, such a great tuner - I bought one for EACH of my guitars!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. After ordering one of these awesome/tiny tuners, and immediately falling in love with it, I ordered 3 more for other guitars! Of course you can clip it to different guitars, but for this cheap, why not get one for each of em! Tuning is fast and accurate, and works by sensing the string vibration - not the volume. So you can quickly and easily tune without having to make any noise at all - great for playing electric, live, in a band, you name it.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, accurate, tiny, lightweight, reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the most convenient clip-on tuner yet. I still really like my TC Polytune Clip On, but this tuner is a fifth the cost, and just as accurate. Plus: It fits a wide range of headstock thicknesses equally well. It can be swiveled to any position It uses the industry standard CR2032 battery It weighs next to nothing You can leave it on your guitar in the case And did I mention it's really cheap? Bought in the 2-pack it's less than $10, which makes it a no-brainer to put one on every guitar you own.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Edelman

customer_reviews.title: Not a Solid Build, Not for Daylight Gigs, and Not Grear for a P bass
customer_reviews.text: As it's small (which, of course is the selling point) and the display is very dim, it's impossible to read this in daylight. Also, not a solid build. It fell a few feet and exploded when it hit the floor. I was able to put it back together, but it feels even less solid now. Also, it doesn't fit well in the spot I wanted it on the head stock of my Fender P-bass due to the size of the machine head parts there.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best of the bunch in its class, plus more features...
customer_reviews.text: So tiny, they are nearly invisible to anyone except the user. Best all, these can work alone attached to best place on headstock. But even better is when slid into the designed slot on the excellent variable pressure easy to use capos. Check tuning anywhere when attached to the matched capo. Best part of this is that when the capo is properly adjusted to be just tight enough to press strings without pulling strings out of tune. Easy to check tuning and still so small it is invisible to all but the user. Excellent accuracy regardless of position.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: These tuners are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things! They are very unobtrusive, fit tightly on the headstock, rotate so that I can see them in the normal playing position, are easy to read, and are not affected by ambient noise. The fact that they only respond to guitar vibrations and do not "hear," make them perfect for tuning the guitar in a noisy environment. I just ordered two more.
customer_reviews.author: Burton R. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Neat and useful!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very accurate. A little hard to read in low light conditions, mostly due to it's small size but the odd shaped letters (digital) don't help either.
customer_reviews.author: XXX

customer_reviews.title: Slow response
customer_reviews.text: After using this tuner for a few months now I have found it is very slow to respond to my electric guitars low E string. I have tried several locations all with the same result. Also, half of the time you have to re-strike the string to see where your tuning is after adjustment. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: buzz66boy

customer_reviews.title: Overall good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a month and it's good overall. Just didn't have great instructions as far as the reading goes... there are colors and I was hoping for a clue on coding of those colors. Also, the battery seems to be fading fast but it's ok. It's reading pretty fast and pretty accurately overall. Overall good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can be buzzy
customer_reviews.text: What I like about these is that they are very small and easily fit in the case while still on the headstock. They stay on well and are easy to operate. The reason I am giving it 3 stars is because I frequently notice buzzing. It is so noticeable that I have to remove them when doing live recording with a microphone. There doesn't seem to be anything that I am doing wrong. It seems that something between how it clamps and the swivel of the top causes a slight buzz. If I was using this on an electric, it'd be a non issue. Alas.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The form factor on this tuner is great, and it is really easy to use. It has already become indispensable to me. The only issue I've experienced is that often it cannot "hear" or detect me playing the low E string. I work around this by playing the 12th fret harmonic on that string and tuning that, but it is a flaw in an otherwise perfect little device.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Pater

customer_reviews.title: Tiny!
customer_reviews.text: The pictures don't do justice to how small this tuner really is. I can leave it on the headstock when I put the guitar in the case without a problem. I love the fact that you can digitally manipulate the display to suit how you have it situated. The clamp holds securely, and notes are picked up quickly. Couldn't ask for more, and I'll definitely be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: R. Gorsuch

customer_reviews.title: Great Tuner for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast, batteries included. Clips on ANYWHERE via the adjustable clamp. The very clear display can be rotated so viewing is easy from any angle you clamp it at. Ditch the Snark! This one is so sleek you’ll barely notice it (until you need it). AND no big ugly glowing screens sticking out! When this one gives out I’ll be buying another. Well deserved 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: KindleChick

customer_reviews.title: Faster than an app, works on 5-string Bass better.
customer_reviews.text: Works to tune the low strings, B, E on my 5-string Bass. The Fender App on my phone could not hear these low notes. Likely is the phone mic not being designed for such low frequencies. This still has issues with the B string sometimes if I am holding the neck. I have to let it vibrate.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetDan

customer_reviews.title: good tuner small but not as accurate
customer_reviews.text: mine struggles to get a reading depending on where i put it on the headstock, it works but i thought it would be much better than it is. doesnt seem to register the high e unless its clamped in the right spot. super small and cool but needs to be made better or maybe i just got a dud
customer_reviews.author: LiliVale

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 or 4 clip on tuners in the past, and this one is the best. Other larger tuners completely stick out when on your guitar head-stock, and risk being knocked off. This is low profile and is completely adjustable. Best feature is the ability to display the screen right side up or up-side down with a push of a button, so whether on the right side of your neck, the left, the top, the bottom, every way it can clip on you see the tuning note facing the right direction and can be angled for any line of site. Great product - would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These things are pretty great for the price. They are small enough they aren't noticeable by most people though they seem to work pretty reliably for simple tuning adjustments between songs. (I've got them on Fender basses and electric guitars). The one caveat is that I began to hear a slight rattling in one of the ones attached to a bass. It might just be that particular tuner, or (maybe) the low frequency vibrations of a bass guitar are too much for them over time. - At this price though, it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuners, and it hugs the head stock nicely. Very low profile, and case-friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of using my smartphone to "dial-in" my tuning every time I sit down to play, so I went for the 2-pack'ers here on Amazon. Since I usually have an acoustic and electric sitting out, I popped one on both. They are very easy to read and adjust. The display can spin 360 degrees and has a "ratcheting" clip that allows you to really get it on tight without having to worry that it may must fall off...it stays on tight. Also has other multi-angle adjustments. I hope the battery lasts a good while, that'd be the icing on the cake. Can't go wrong with these tuners, really nice and totally worth the price...and then some!
customer_reviews.author: I. B. Watching

customer_reviews.title: It's the best tuner ever.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant because it's so small and my eyes aren't what they used to be, but I'm happy I chose the two pack now. In spite of its miniscule appearance it's super easy to read the display. It's truly a well thought out design. Simple, unintrusive, accurate and extraordinarily versatile, offering a variety of display angles and affording any number of discrete, secure mounting locations. Can't imagine a better tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: D'Addario Accessories Guitar Tuner (PW-CT-12)
product_meta.description:
Enjoy effortless and inconspicuous tuning in the studio or on stage with the D’Addario Accessories (formerly Planet Waves) NS Micro Clip-On Tuner for acoustic and electric guitars, basses, mandolins, banjos and other stringed instruments. The lightweight, discrete, highly compact tuner hides behind the headstock practically blending into the instrument and is small enough to be kept on your instrument while stored in its case. At 1.25”, your audience will never know it’s there and you will want one for every instrument you own. The NS Micro features an extremely accurate piezo transducer that picks up an instrument’s vibration rather than sound. A wide calibration range (410-480Hz) guarantees precise performance adds an additional practice tool.

The easy-to-read, tri-color backlit screen displays the note in red when out of tune, yellow when close, and green when in tune. This allows you to accurately tune with a quick glance at the display - even on dark stages or in direct sunlight. Powered by a readily available (and included) CR2032 battery, you will enjoy maximum battery life thanks to its auto-off function that shuts the tuner off after several minutes of no signal. Featuring a 360-degree swivel mechanism and adjustable padded clamp, the NS Mini offers optimal viewing angles and maximum positioning flexibility. Equally effective on left and right-handed instruments as well as on small and large headstocks, it is the ideal choice for the widest variety of players and string instruments

For over 20 years, D’Addario has been leading the industry in innovative and problem-solving products that serve musicians worldwide. D’Addario Accessories are proudly made in a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility to the most stringent quality controls in the industry. The D’Addario family’s heart, soul and love for making music is put into every accessory we create, and we never stop inspiring performance.

At 1.25”, you will want one for each stringed instrument you own.

VERSATILE - Featuring a 360-degree swivel mechanism and adjustable padded clamp, the NS Mini offers optimal viewing angles and maximum positioning flexibility. For left or right-handed instruments with small or large headstocks, it is the ideal choice for acoustic and electric guitars, basses, mandolins, banjos and ukuleles.

D’ADDARIO ACCESSORIES - For over 20 years, D’Addario Accessories (formerly Planet Waves) has been leading the industry in innovative and problem-solving products that serve musicians worldwide.
